title.native: ウィッチクラフトワークス

description: Takamiya Honoka is a regular student whose only problem seems to be that he sits next to Kagari Ayaka, the school's #1 beauty. They have never spoken to each other before and any small interaction between them immediately results in her fanclub beating him. Yet when a falling part of the school's building is about to send him to the afterlife, it's Kagari that comes to his rescue. Only... she's dressed as a witch, carrying him in her arms and floating on a broom?! Kagari tells him it is her mission to protect him and that now she can finally protect him openly rather than undercover.

name.native: クロノワールシュヴァルツ・シックス

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/278548957) | [Blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/mizshima1941)
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/wcworx/index.html) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=2380893)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)
Yoshio Ookouchi is a composite artist affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.
[Website](http://www.kunion.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/92on) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tsujitakunio)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

More recently she has also been involved in storyboarding and episode directing.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

Among [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most noted directors.

Famous directorial works include [Planetes](https://anilist.co/anime/329/), [Scryed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/), [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/) as well as [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/), which is an original story created by him and the series' lead writer [Ichirou Ookouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98067/). Taniguchi is the one who proposed the idea to the producers at Sunrise. The basic idea for the plot consisted of a "hero" who led a secret organization, which was later developed into a conflict between two characters with different values and who belonged to the same military unit.
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.
